body: @Kami BTW, thank you for all your support. :)
Was this pull request opened intentionally?
@Kami Is anything missing? I could provide the whole debug log of the interaction or maybe some credentials for testing if needed
@sfriesel I'll have a look asap.

I need to spend some more time testing this myself. The reason for this is that we are using S3 compatible API which requires you to send `x-amzn` headers.

From your pull request, it seems like you can use `x-goog` headers even if you use the S3 compatible API, but I need to confirm this myself.

@baldwinmathew Great and you are welcome.

I will look into your changes and and look into merging this pull request into trunk this weekend :)
/cc @wrigri @erjohnso

I just tested your changes and verified it works correctly.

While testing the changes I also noticed meta_data is only returned when retrieving information for a single object (`get_object`), but not when listing objects (`list_container_objects`).

I will update documentation and add a note about this known limitation.
Merged into trunk. Thanks!

Looks good.

I've made "a bunch of ifs" to "for loop" change and merged patch into trunk. Thanks!

@PeterDaveHello, your commit message does not explain how your change reduces the build times, or what side-effects it may have on build stability. Could you please update your commit message to include comments on those issues.
Sure, updated :)

A while ago, I timed `git clone ...` and `git clone --depth=1` and there was basically no difference in timings / the difference was negligible.

That's probably because our history is pretty small and simple.

It seems, based on limited searching, that Travis CI already sets a clone [depth of 100](https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/617), and that setting limits close to 1 may introduce additional [build instability](https://github.com/Freeseer/freeseer/commit/84252a6afc1465265565dd72d17c0bc438ba0988).
/cc @erjohnso @wrigri
This all looks like good stuff to me. (Will need a couple tweaks for the lint stuff, but otherwise they seem like all good fixes.)

Sorry about the lint.

BTW this summer I had spent tens of hours testing GCE driver for completeness 
and correctness. Except for images and multiple node creation code which I 
didn't test, these fixes are the only problems I had discovered.

And libcloud now has another happy "client": NixOps deployment tool.

As far as I'm concerned, the GCE driver may not be complete, but it's very 
bug-free now :)

@Phreedom no problem and glad to hear that :)

Do let us know if you encounter any other issues in the future or if there is anything else we can do to make the experience even better.
@Phreedom Changes merged into trunk - thanks!
Looks good to me! :+1:
Is there anyone following up with the merge of this pull request ?

LGTM, merged into trunk.

Thanks!

@katrielt Can you please synchronize your branch with trunk and squash all the commits (I'm having problems merging this directly into trunk).

Also, next time feel free to ping me after you address the issues since I don't receive a notification when you push new commits.

Thanks for the ping. Was un-aware of that.
I've attached the squashed and formatted patch to the jira case at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LIBCLOUD-611

I still had some issues with applying the patch since it appears your branch is not synchronized with trunk, but I went ahead and picked the changes manually.

Changes are merged into trunk now - thanks.
That is weird, as I pulled from the upstream repo. at https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/libcloud.git. Anyway, thank you.
@Kami is there any chance this change could salvage work from [LIBCLOUD-122](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LIBCLOUD-122)?

@hbetts Will have a look when I get a chance.

Overall, I need to spend some more polishing and finishing up this branch (add EC2 driver and tests). After that, we can hopefully get more discussion going and get it merged into trunk in some reasonable time frame.
Is this PR waiting on additional input from me, ie, is there something missing? wrong? I can fix it, just let me know,
Not that @Kami has to wait for me, but I was going to do some quick tests this week and then give an LGTM.
Oh, OK! No worries ;)

Hi Pham:

Yes, we're currently re-working this compute driver to utilize ET versus
how it is currently implemented. Unfortunately, I've been delayed in being
able to return to this. I'm hoping I will have more time in mid-October to
pick this back up and knock it out.

Thanks.
-matt

wrote:

> Is there anyone following up with the merge of this pull request ?
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/libcloud/pull/305#issuecomment-56468111.
Started the ET support this week Matt - will commit this weekend and pickup with you.

Sweet. Thanks Richard!

On Wed, Sep 24, 2014 at 12:51 AM, Richard Conway notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Started the ET support this week Matt - will commit this weekend and
> pickup with you.
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/libcloud/pull/305#issuecomment-56636239.

This commit contains extra functionality for the cloudstack driver with respect to VPC support.
Credits go to my colleague: Jeroen de Korte.

vpc: list create delete
egress_fw_rules: list create delete
vpcofferings: list
- necessary tests

This should get closed automatically, but in case it does not, please close it.
https://github.com/apache/libcloud/commit/d608085e3da79240b2b56709ef6adb58bd9c9dab

thanks for the patch

I modified the code to be more robust and use `.get` since I'm not sure if those attributes are always present (e.g. different OpenStack versions) and merged your changes into trunk.

Thanks.

Good catch.

Merged into trunk. Thanks.
Thanks!
Thanks!
Can you take a look at the PR now - we've updated the xml serialization to use element tree as advised as can successfully run all compute functions and all unit tests pass
looks good to me, thanks for the tests.

@runseb let me know if you want to get rid of those indent changes which slipped through, most probably because I switched to pycharm vs pydev.
When do you expect a new release with this functionality added?
Hi @boul yes it would be nice to revert those indent changes. Next release will probably be in couple weeks
Reverted the slipped indents

Thanks David. I'll review this over the weekend. Then we can go from there.

On Fri, Oct 3, 2014 at 2:24 AM, davidcrossland notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Can you take a look at the PR now - we've updated the xml serialization to
> use element tree as advised as can successfully run all compute functions
> and all unit tests pass
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/libcloud/pull/305#issuecomment-57772973.

Thanks.

There is a minor issue with a string / boolean in a public API, but besides that it looks good.
It would also be nice if you could add some documentation on how to use `ex_config_drive` and `ex_userdata` :)

Well, so. I was a bit off on my timing, sorry @s0undt3ch.

@Kami - LGTM to merge!
No problem!
The value is still a string on the API side, but I've set it up as a boolean on the client side. I've also added an example to show how to use it.

Thanks.

It would be great if we could also document how to use that and add some examples to GCE docs - libcloud/docs/compute/drivers/gce.rst.
Merged into trunk. Thanks.

@Kami - excellent idea, added.  This is my first time adding to docs, and I didn't see anything on the contributors/developers page to know how to generate / view the proposed changes (sorry if I didn't look hard enough!)
@Kami :) :shipit:
Allright, methods have been renamed (attach/detach vs add/remove)

@erjohnso thanks for adding this feature.

@Kami the lint check failed due to the documentation changes. There is nothing obviously wrong with the docs though from what I can see. Any chance you could take a look at that?  :)

@erjohnso @ross-p Thanks!

I went ahead, fixed the lint issues and merge it into trunk.

The lint issues were related to the code examples:

```
docs/examples/compute/gce/gce_service_account_scopes.py:15:3: E121 continuation line under-indented for hanging indent
docs/examples/compute/gce/gce_service_account_scopes.py:17:3: E124 closing bracket does not match visual indentation
docs/examples/compute/gce/gce_service_account_scopes.py:25:10: F821 undefined name 'driver'
```
@Kami - thanks! I totally missed there were issues there. :(
Thanks @Kami much appreciated.  :)

/me sighs - I never seem to get Travis to smile on the first try...  These errors seem unrelated to the PR.

```
pypy runtests: commands[0] | cp libcloud/test/secrets.py-dist libcloud/test/secrets.py
WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
  cmd: /bin/cp
  env: /home/travis/build/apache/libcloud/.tox/pypy
Maybe forgot to specify a dependency?
```
@s0undt3ch Sorry for the delay - I was traveling and missed the LGTM comment.
No worries.
Hot diggity! Travis is even happy (after fixing my legitimate errors...)
/cc @erjohnso @wrigri

@franckcuny - thanks!
@Kami - LGTM

@erjohnso Great, thanks.

I'm having problems cleanly applying patch to the trunk. Can you please sync your branch with trunk and squash the commits?

@Kami - can you give this a try?  I think it's safe to disregard the scary merge-conflict warning. I did manually resolve the conflicts on `libcloud/utils/connection.py` and `libcloud/compute/drivers/gce.py` and rebased.  I'm not sure what I did, but if you run into issues with this attempt, I'm going to whack this PR and create a new one.

@erjohnso 

```
kami /w/lc/libcloud (git:trunk)$ git am --signoff < 20d977075117f05a0d8cd8ceb91c4dfcd93a7766.patch
Applying: LIBCLOUD-625: Allow for internal GCE authorization with metadata service
error: patch failed: libcloud/compute/drivers/gce.py:550
error: libcloud/compute/drivers/gce.py: patch does not apply
error: patch failed: libcloud/utils/connection.py:21
error: libcloud/utils/connection.py: patch does not apply
Patch failed at 0001 LIBCLOUD-625: Allow for internal GCE authorization with metadata service
The copy of the patch that failed is found in:
   /w/lc/libcloud/.git/rebase-apply/patch
When you have resolved this problem, run "git am --continue".
If you prefer to skip this patch, run "git am --skip" instead.
To restore the original branch and stop patching, run "git am --abort"
```

It's fine, I will try to pull down your branch and merge it directly into trunk.

Merged into trunk. Thanks.

There was a minor merge conflict - can you please make sure that everything still works as expected in trunk?

Thanks.
Merged into trunk. Thanks.
@Kami - thank you!  Tested out trunk and it's working as expected.

Changes look good to me.

I need to some more testing and if everything works OK, I will go ahead and merge it into trunk as soon as 0.16.0 release is out.

Merged into trunk.

Thanks.
@kami @runseb: Is there still something we need to fix before it can be merged into trunk? thx

@ZuluPro Hey, any progress on this?

It would be great if those comments would get addressed so the driver can be included in the next release.

Sorry for a long delay. I totally missed this PR.

I went ahead and merged it into trunk (I still need to manually test the EC2 changes though). Thanks.

Next time if no one responds to your PR in a reasonable time frame, feel free to periodically ping us.
Thanks @Kami !

I've been working on a branch of this, adding in some functionality I needed for a project. You can see my branch here: https://github.com/SecurityCompass/libcloud/commits/LIBCLOUD-556_azure_compute_driver_rebased

I've added some functionality like displaying custom VM images along with the azure provided ones, creating nodes using custom VMs, and using NodeSize, NodeLocation, and NodeImage for the arguments to create node. I also rebased this branch on almost the latest trunk and fixed some issues there.

It looks like there might be some overlap in some of the current efforts and I imagine the easiest approach is for me to pull in the changes and then open a PR back to this branch. Is anything else being actively worked on that I should wait for?

All your requests are now fixed at master of my fork.

I fixed the first line of License
Fix import statement, now with try/except,  import simplejson as json
I moved service_type & auth_url in Connection class

Hi Michael  we did a recent commit to add ET. We need this functionality too as does Matt B. Weve got a full test coverage currently. Please feel free to pull in the changes. Were still waiting for this branch to be merged as it happens.

All the best,

Richard Conway

From: Michael Bennett [mailto:notifications@github.com]
Sent: Wednesday, October 29, 2014 4:00 PM
To: apache/libcloud
Cc: Richard Conway
Subject: Re: [libcloud] [Libcloud-556] Azure Compute Driver Support (#305)

I've working on a branch of this, adding in some functionality I needed for a project. You can see my branch here: https://github.com/SecurityCompass/libcloud/commits/LIBCLOUD-556_azure_compute_driver_rebased

I've added some functionality like displaying custom VM images along with the azure provided ones, creating nodes using custom VMs, and using NodeSize, NodeLocation, and NodeImage for the arguments to create node. I also rebased this branch on almost the latest trunk and fixed some issues there.

It looks like there might be some overlap in some of the current efforts and I imagine the easiest approach is for me to pull in the changes and then open a PR back to this branch. Is anything else being actively worked on that I should wait for?


Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/apache/libcloud/pull/305#issuecomment-60950727.
Good catch. Patch merged into trunk - thanks!

Fixed lint and merged into trunk.

Thanks!
I will also try to find some time this week and test the driver against the actual live API.
@Kami I applied your review. Thank you for your comments.
Please also add some basic docs to `docs/compute/drivers/vultr.rst`.

LGTM

/cc @erjohnso
LGTM too.  @Kami - any chance we can get this merged for 0.16.0?

@Kami I applied your review. Thanks.
1. add code for InvalidCreds as 403
2. change 200 to httplib.OK
3. add vultr.rst

@erjohnso Sadly it's too late for 0.16.0 since the voting thread has already been started.

If it's a critical fix, we can just start a voting thread for 0.16.1 release once the 0.16.0 is out.
@Kami I changed urllib.urlencode to urlencode for py3 compatibility.
Merged into trunk. Thanks.
@charsyam Did you (force) push your changes? Since I can't see them here.

@Kami hmm. I pushed it force

In my latest branch, it is applied. 
https://github.com/charsyam/libcloud/commit/6895572a9348ec306e82e50402f2ea574f9bbe19

is it need some time to apply?
@Kami It is applied now. maybe it needed time to apply. :)
@charsyam I still don't see httplib, 403 status code and polling changes.

@charsyam I see the changes now - looks like you just pushed.

I'll go ahead, fix the xrange issue myself and merge patch into trunk.

@charsyam Ignore my last comment - I just noticed documentation is still missing.

I assume you just forgot to add the file to git index. Please add it, push and let me know when you have done this.
